wiki.content:
"Drowning" is the single by the Backstreet Boys from their compilation album The Hits: Chapter One. The song was initially recorded for the Black & Blue album, but did not make it in time for the recording deadline in September 2000. It features Kevin Richardson on piano. This was their last song before a four-year-hiatus from 2001 - 2005. The song reached #28 in the US on November 13, 2001. The song also did moderately well in the international charts, peaking at #3 in Sweden and #5 in Norway. The song also did exceptionally well on TRL, and the video for it was retired on February 26, 2002.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Drowning" is the single by the Backstreet Boys from their compilation album The Hits: Chapter One. The song was initially recorded for the Black & Blue album, but did not make it in time for the recording deadline in September 2000. It features Kevin Richardson on piano. This was their last song before a four-year-hiatus from 2001 - 2005. The song reached #28 in the US on November 13, 2001. The song also did moderately well in the international charts, peaking at #3 in Sweden and #5 in Norway. The song also did exceptionally well on TRL, and the video for it was retired on February 26, 2002.

track.name: Drowning
comments: Everything about this song is perfect.
One of their classics for me.
May have stole the Melody (at the Beginning) from O Town but who cares?
too good song from pop style which I don't like generally... but this has so much memories in it and is filled with feelings....
лично мне припев напоминает Duran Duran - Ordinary World
Their last "super hit", I remember the first time I listen to it and feeling sad because I knew they were not going to be as popular as they were.
Great song. Reggae version is cool too
I fell in love with this song the first time i heard it :')
<3. This is the most played song on my Ipod :).
